intro: Potentilla victorialis, commonly known as the golden cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, usually from June to July. Its leaves are palmately divided into five oval-shaped lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Potentilla victorialis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas.
